abstract.text: A set of methods that defines the interface for retrieving a representation of an object that can be written to a pasteboard.

inlineContent.text: implement this protocol. You can make your custom class conform to this protocol so that you can write instances of the class to a pasteboard using the

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity (alpha value).
An object that provides a promise for the pasteboard.
A high-level interface for manipulating image data.
An object that transfers data to and from the pasteboard server.
Options for preparing the pasteboard.
Type to specify options for writing to a pasteboard.
Writes an array of objects to the receiver.
An item on a pasteboard.
A set of methods implemented by the data provider of a pasteboard item to provide the data for a particular UTI type.
A set of methods that defines the interface for initializing an object from a pasteboard.
An object that serves as a data provider for data types that use lazy data fulfillment from a pasteboard request.
A set of methods that defines the interface for retrieving a representation of an object that can be written to a pasteboard.
Returns a property list object to represent the receiver on a pasteboard as an object of a specified type.
Returns an array of UTI strings of data types the receiver can write to a given pasteboard.
Returns options for writing data of a specified type to a given pasteboard.
A simple interface for loading and playing audio files.
The fundamental storage mechanism of TextKit that contains the text managed by the system.
Constant to specify options for writing to a pasteboard, used by
A string of text that manages data, layout, and stylistic information for ranges of characters to support rendering.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
An object representing the location of a resource that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.

value.text: An object that represents the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
